text: ਗਉੜੀ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀ ਕੀ ਨਾਲਿ ਰਲਾਇ ਲਿਖਿਆ ਮਹਲਾ ੫ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Gauree, Kabeer Jee, With Writings Of The Fifth Mehl:

transliteration.text: gaurī kabīr jī kī nāl ralāi likhiā mahalā 5 .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir and Guru Arjan Dev
author.description: Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, included this hymn by Saint Kabir, and also added his writings to it

text: ਦਧਿ ਕੈ ਭੋਲੈ ਬਿਰੋਲੈ ਨੀਰੁ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Mistaking it for cream, the people are churning water. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: dadh kai bhōlai birōlai nīr .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir and Guru Arjan Dev
author.description: Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, included this hymn by Saint Kabir, and also added his writings to it

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: arising each day, he laughs and brays, and then dies. ||1||

However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, a strange sport has become manifest:

translation.text: Chanting the Lord's Name, my intellect is enlightened.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, the Guru has blessed me with this understanding. ||4||1||14||
